pageContext.claim: “The previous administration spent over $7 billion trying to upgrade the system, and totally failed. Honestly, they didn’t know what the hell they were doing.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to the NextGen program, to modernize the air traffic control system. He characterizes this program as an Obama-era error, but the planning began in 2000 and faced delays from the beginning. But some new capabilities under NextGen are already in effect or on track for 2020-2025. While the majority of the $7.4 billion the Federal Aviation Administration received for NextGen was given to the agency in fiscal 2009-2016, it represents just 4 percent of the total money appropriated to the FAA between fiscal 2004 (when the program began) and fiscal 2016.
